description: Yerevan's most famous open-air market near Republic Square, bustling seven days a week with traditional Armenian crafts, Soviet-era memorabilia, and handmade goods. A treasure trove of artistic expression where local artisans and vendors showcase everything from hand-carved instruments to vintage collectibles.
highlights: Hand-carved wooden chess and backgammon sets, Armenian duduk instruments
Traditional hand-woven carpets and textiles from all regions of Armenia
Soviet memorabilia including vintage dishware, records, and porcelain figurines
Armenian silver jewelry featuring prominent pomegranate designs
Paintings, traditional dolls, carved crosses, and self-woven textiles
tips: Bargaining is customary and expected - negotiate for best prices
Saturdays and Sundays are busiest with most vendors present
Open daily 10am-6pm, winter hours may vary
Be cautious about handmade claims - verify authenticity
Right side for carpets, left side for paintings when entering from Republic Square
vibe: Vibrant, authentic marketplace energy where Armenian culture comes alive through crafts, colors, and conversation - a sensory feast of tradition and creativity
